comment.author: 29201707@N00
comment._content: love the ghostly quality to this

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: Sweet : ) I love how prim and white his collar is and how dirty his little legs are. Somehow his top half with the hat and the little coat seems a bit overdressed compared to his bare feet and shorts! -- seen in the Powerhouse Museum Discussion thread in the Flickr Commons group.

comment.author: 8822983@N08
comment._content: I agree it's "tabby"cat and there is something fishy obout the dog - the scale looks wrong, one paw doesn't seem to meet the ground and the other one on the kid's knee looks like a cut out, my guess is fido is an add-in. The cat could be as well, it appears very two dimensional like a cardboard cut out that has been curved to make it stand up. I think it's a photo of a toy either in the original or also added later. While a nice little tableau, I think it's an artifice and fairly normal practice even for that time. Anyone?

comment.author: 74491857@N00
comment._content: He is dressed exactly like Buster Brown.

comment.author: 25432556@N02
comment._content: I like the way he looks, his dirty feet and legs , dog foot on his right knee, the cat just sitting still ... Lovely composition.

comment.author: 32570177@N06
comment._content: it seems someone or something is approaching the boy; the boy does not seem startled, but the dog does.  I have seen many antique photos and the cat and the boy look very familiar; I can't place where.

comment.author: 36132153@N03
comment._content: the child and the animals are adorable!~

comment.author: 63332509@N00
comment._content: @Merryjack: I think the cat is a toy cat... the fabric is printed to look like a cat - the type of stuffed cat (or animal) I have in mind usually consists of a front and back piece of fabric printed (or embroidered considering the age of this photo) to look like the front and back of the animal, sometimes there is also a base to help it stand (kind of like a fabric stuffed version of a cardboard cut-out if that makes any sense... it's 2am here gimme a break!) As a child, I had an old set of this type of toy cat, a mama and two kittens the mama and one kitten were grey tabby, and the other kitten was orange. They were very simple, but I loved them! :D

comment.author: 53313968@N00
comment._content: The cat definitely has some sort of tag on it and it appears to be a cutout as someone else mentioned. The dog is, I believe, a real dog, but was clumsily added to the photo later. The exposure for the dog is decidedly different than it is for the remainder of the photo. I agree that the paw that's supposedly on the ground isn't on the ground at all. I'm also not completely convinced that the dog is a Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever as the tags state.
